info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 23 at 8:14AM EDT until July 23 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM EDT FOR WESTERN ALLEN...NORTHERN WABASH...NOBLE...WHITLEY...SOUTHWESTERN DE KALB...NORTHERN HUNTINGTON AND EASTERN KOSCIUSKO COUNTIES... At 813 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Rome City to Churubusco to 6 miles northwest of Huntington, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Fort Wayne, Huntington, Warsaw, Auburn, Kendallville, Columbia City, Garrett, North Manchester, Winona Lake, Ligonier, Tri-lakes, Huntertown, Avilla, Albion, Churubusco, South Whitley, Rome City, North Webster, Pierceton and Aboite. This includes the following highways... Interstate 469 near mile marker 0, between mile markers 2 and 3, and between mile markers 7 and 8, and near mile marker 30. Interstate 69 in Indiana near mile marker 291, and between mile markers 294 and 329. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
